title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 June 2012 - XWiki
content:
01:00 <jvdrean> has quit  
01:54 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
03:36 <jssol> has quit  
06:07 <npm> has quit  
06:14 <CIA-117> Caleb James DeLisle master \* re022e6a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/e022e6aa34cf8ef483e62d0f05624ab1f8c1ee95 / xwiki-commons-tools/xwiki-commons-tool-xar/xwiki-commons-tool-xar-handlers/pom.xml : [misc] Fix xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin build failure. - http://git.io/RpN2TQ  
06:27 <tekzilla> has quit  
06:29 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
06:33 <CIA-117> Caleb James DeLisle master \* rfd04cb8 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/fd04cb89ef83ff119759f26269be645b1e6f0a84 / xwiki-commons-tools/xwiki-commons-tool-xar/xwiki-commons-tool-xar-handlers/pom.xml : Didn't test properly, still broken. - http://git.io/12MYfw  
06:36 <ssavi> has quit  
07:02 <CIA-117> Caleb James DeLisle master \* r0c9a607 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/0c9a6074c915f1f481fed6782299ad6a5ce0a2e5 / xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin/src/it/package-simple/pom.xml : [misc] Try to fix build (xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin) - http://git.io/p3yWpg  
07:05 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
07:53 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:54 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
07:57 <CIA-117> has quit  
07:59 <rrodriguez> has quit  
08:02 <@cjd> vmassol: good morning, fixed the bug blocking platform but I'm pretty sure the <pluginManagement> tag should be moved somewhere else.  
08:02 <@cjd> Does adding it to the xar-handler make sense?  
08:02 <vmassol> good morning  
08:02 <vmassol> no  
08:02 <vmassol> it doesn't  
08:03 <vmassol> you need to put some comment to explain why because otherwise it's ust black maghic  
08:03 <vmassol> magic  
08:03 <vmassol> note that I had tried this locally btw and it didn't help  
08:03 <@cjd> Should I just add a comment there and leave it where it is?  
08:03 <vmassol> the comment needs to explain why it should be like this  
08:04 <@cjd> I can explain why it fixes the problem :)  
08:04 <vmassol> have you really proved it works?  
08:04 <vmassol> because again it didn't for me  
08:04 <vmassol> (when I had the 4.1rc1 in my lcoal repo)  
08:04 <@cjd> the ci server is happy with it  
08:05 <vmassol> ok, if you know why it works and can explain it then ok ofc  
08:05 <vmassol> I'm eager to see the explanation :)  
08:05 <@cjd> ok, I put it there with the assumption it would be moved somewhere else..  
08:06 <@cjd> I'm kind of firing from the hip here but based on how maven seems to operate, the extension is pulling the plugin in as a dependency but not as a plugin so the runtime dependency is versioned but not the plugin which ends up being required.  
08:15 <@cjd> the first attempt, changing ${project.version} to ${commons.version} was based on an assumption that <extension> pom file is copied in verbatum.  
08:16 <@cjd> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/2135ab07fb1c79cb068aec7d7dbb27468501e184  
08:16 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <CIA-114> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <@cjd> mflorea: what's the status of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7833 ?  
08:37 <+mflorea> I haven't found a solution so I'll revert the part of my commit that causes the problem  
08:37 <+mflorea> give me a few minutes  
08:38 <@cjd> ok  
08:50 <vmassol> "I'm kind of firing from the hip here but based on how maven seems to operate, the extension is pulling the plugin in as a dependency but not as a plugin so the runtime dependency is versioned but not the plugin which ends up being required.". If that's true then there's an important bug in maven and we can certainly find a jira issue about it and add it to our pom.xml doc  
08:53 <@cjd> Not sure even what to search for  
08:54 <vmassol> my guess  
08:54 <vmassol> is that this was introduced by my recent upgrade of some maven plugins  
08:54 <vmassol> from yesterday  
08:55 <vmassol> now I don't see which plugin could have caused this  
08:55 <vmassol> ah there's one  
08:55 <vmassol> the enforcer plugin  
08:55 <@cjd> was plugin plugin upgraded?  
08:55 <vmassol> no  
08:55 <vmassol> the error is from the enforcer plugin right?  
08:55 <@cjd> yes  
08:55 <vmassol> ok so it must come from that  
08:56 <@cjd> perhaps it was this way and it just "worked" even though it was broken?  
08:56 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XCOMMONS-193  
08:56 <vmassol> it could be this one:  
08:56 <vmassol>  \* [MENFORCER-98] - requirePluginVersions rule is not compatible with maven 3.0-beta-1  
08:56 <vmassol> it was broken and thus we didn't notice the issue  
08:57 <@cjd> My concern is anything else which pulls in -xar-handlers is going to run into it as well.  
08:58 <vmassol> well we could easily exclude it from clirr  
08:58 <vmassol> (just this plugin)  
08:58 <vmassol> but I resisted from doing this yesterday since I wanted to understand the problem  
08:58 <@cjd> re your github comment, agent-1 still has rc-1 in it's m2 repo and it built platform ok  
08:59 <@cjd> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/2130/  
08:59 <vmassol> what i did locally was slightly different  
08:59 <vmassol> I added it as a direct dep not as a a mgmt dep  
08:59 <@cjd> ahh i see  
09:01 <vmassol> so do you know why it fails when there's 4.1RC1 in the local repo?  
09:01 <vmassol> it sees no version so it looks for the latest one  
09:01 <CIA-114> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r8358220 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/83582209a517f26b1ce14f750869895e9adab366 / (3 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7833: components.txt is not merged when releasing legacy modules - http://git.io/eD94Jg  
09:01 <vmassol> that's the explanation  
09:02 <vmassol> now  
09:02 <vmassol> when there's not 4.1RC1  
09:02 <vmassol> there's only snapshot  
09:02 <CIA-114> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-4.1.x \* rf2f4254 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/f2f4254afb026c7de932a18a57eff1407728f6aa / (3 files in 3 dirs): XWIKI-7833: components.txt is not merged when releasing legacy modules - http://git.io/CgCCsw  
09:02 <@cjd> it is definitely unversioned  
09:02 <vmassol> but it doesn't report it because we said not to report snapshot versioning  
09:02 <@cjd> because it says it selected 4.1-milestone-2  
09:02 <vmassol> hmm  
09:02 <vmassol> does it?  
09:03 <@cjd> let me paste the error  
09:03 <vmassol> and why wouldn't it report an error?  
09:04 <@cjd> https://ezcrypt.it/ge5n#2JYPITcLz63vdnDK8IuyasrD  
09:04 <vmassol> but it worked locally  
09:04 <vmassol> maybe I didn't have 4.1m2  
09:04 <vmassol> let me remove your "fix" and retry  
09:05 <vmassol> yep I have only 4.2-SNAPSHOT in my local repo  
09:05 <vmassol> so it would pitck it  
09:06 <vmassol> but not report it since:  
09:06 <vmassol>                 <requirePluginVersions>  
09:06 <vmassol>                   <message>Best Practice is to always define plugin versions!</message>  
09:06 <vmassol>                   <banLatest>false</banLatest>  
09:06 <vmassol>                   <banRelease>false</banRelease>  
09:06 <vmassol>                   <banSnapshots>false</banSnapshots>  
09:06 <vmassol>                 </requirePluginVersions>  
09:06 <vmassol> hmm  
09:06 <vmassol> yep that works  
09:07 <vmassol> latest means using -LATEST and release means -RELEASE  
09:07 <vmassol> not sure why we have that btw  
09:07 <vmassol> hmm well it's a choice  
09:07 <vmassol> well it means we always want a version but we don't care which one it is  
09:08 <vmassol> hmm  
09:08 <vmassol> ok I'll try locally again just to be sure it doesn't fail  
09:08 <@cjd> o/t anything holding up rc-1 for you?  
09:08 <vmassol> have you checked the list of blockers?  
09:09 <vmassol> the list people reported  
09:09 <@cjd> I only see one blocker issue with rc-1 listed as the fix version  
09:09 <vmassol> just checked mails, looks ok  
09:10 <@cjd> http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator!executeAdvanced.jspa?jqlQuery=fixVersion+%3D+%224.1-rc-1%22+and+status+%21%3D+Closed&runQuery=true&clear=true  
09:10 <@cjd> now just one issue which looks like a mistake  
09:10 <@cjd> but I'll wait until Thomas shows up.  
09:11 <vmassol> yep better  
09:11 <vmassol> on my side I'm ok  
09:11 <vmassol> mflorea is ok  
09:11 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ok?  
09:11 <vmassol> sburjan`: any known blocker for the RC1 release from your side?  
09:11 <+mflorea> yep, I'm done  
09:15 <@cjd> I just listened to a speech by Zed Shaw, that guy turns out to really know what he's talking about. When I first saw his lesson stuff I thought it was just a ploy.  
09:17 <vmassol> never heard about him, link?  
09:17 <@cjd> http://zedshaw.com/essays/  
09:17 <@cjd> I've been reading all the way down this list  
09:17 <@cjd> heh  
09:19 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <@cjd> He talks quite a bit about managing big projects in "The C2I2 Hypothesis"  
09:19 <@cjd> and a couple others  
09:20 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <@cjd> tmortagne: good morning, what's the status on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7652 and do you have any other issues blocking rc-1?  
09:22 <@cjd> sburjan: how about you? anything holding up rc-1?  
09:22 <+tmortagne> cjd: Hi, let me see  
09:22 <+sburjan> I didn't test rc-1 yet  
09:22 <+tmortagne> its not blonking it actually, forgot to move it  
09:23 <vmassol> cjd: ok I have the same issue locally than you now :)  
09:23 <@cjd> Zed did the learn python the hard way and ruthlessly and quite effectively promoted it  
09:23 <vmassol> org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-tool-xar-plugin.        The version currently in use is 4.1-milestone-2  
09:23 <vmassol> so at least we're consistent  
09:23 <+sburjan> I still have time until tomorrow evening, right ?  
09:23 <vmassol> well it's too late sburjan  
09:23 <vmassol> unless you don't find any bug  
09:23 <vmassol> :)  
09:24 <+sburjan> Friday I tested the installers  
09:24 <+sburjan> and then it was weekend  
09:24 <vmassol> we should release it today  
09:24 <vmassol> and then we have 1 week to find and fix any blocking bug till the final  
09:25 <vmassol> (final is planned for 18th)  
09:25 <+sburjan> also the release process is a total mess in my head after so many votes and discussions. someone should send a digest of what we finally decided  
09:25 <vmassol> yep same for me  
09:25 <@cjd> I'm basicly following orders as given by vmassol :)  
09:26 <vmassol> cjd: in this case please continue as we were doing FTM  
09:26 <vmassol> ie we release rc1 today as usual and release final on next Monday  
09:26 <vmassol> then we can talk about doing things differently  
09:27 <vmassol> normally sorin's job is to test at least RC1  
09:27 <@cjd> I wrote to the list to try to document what we discussed, it would be nice to hear an ack from you to make sure it wasn't misunderstood  
09:27 <vmassol> yep I parked your email to read it slowly  
09:27 <@cjd> [xwiki-devs] [Proposal] Change to the 4.1-rc-1 and 4.1 release process.  
09:28 <vmassol> cjd: you should know that I'm going to a conferecne on thursday/friday and I need to prepare my talk so I'm not going to have much time at the beginning of this week  
09:29 <+sburjan> yes well I will test RC-1, but that usually requires at least one day. one day which I didn't have  
09:29 <vmassol> sburjan: RC1 is not releaed  
09:29 <vmassol> so I don't understand your point  
09:30 <@cjd> cool and good luck, just a plain ack or "change this then ack" is enough.  
09:30 <@cjd> sburjan: I think vmassol's saying that it's fine to do post-rc1-release testing.  
09:30 <vmassol> yep as we've done so far  
09:30 <+sburjan> ah ok  
09:30 <+sburjan> :)  
09:30 <vmassol> so you'll get your one day :)  
09:30 <+sburjan> yeah :)  
09:31 <@cjd> for RC that makes sense, for final, testing after release is D: but that's something to work on.  
09:31 <vmassol> well RC is for that  
09:31 <vmassol> to have a perfect final  
09:31 <vmassol> bugs that still happen in final are fixed in point releases if blockers  
09:32 <@cjd> yes, renaming the rc to final would work. making changes to an rc then building it as final is the problem.  
09:32 <vmassol> it's not that bad  
09:32 <vmassol> because our build is automated  
09:33 <vmassol> and so far I don't remember any issue we've had with this  
09:33 <+tmortagne> it's not like our build was giving random results ;)  
09:33 <@cjd> the issue is that the changes to the RC don't go through manual testing themselves..  
09:33 <vmassol> yep sure  
09:33 <@cjd> Perhaps it is a smaller issue than I make it out to be since the changes are theoretically small.  
09:34 <vmassol> which is why we should accept only real blockers (thus not a lot) and small stuff + have all our eyes on it  
09:34 <@cjd> /nod  
09:38 <+sburjan> cjd: the blockers do.. so we confirm they are fixed before finalr elease  
09:38 <vmassol> cjd: replied  
09:41 <@cjd> yes, my proposal was to just stage once and not re-stage at all until it's time to release.  
09:41 <@cjd> and in this case the whole idea of staging is basicly optional  
09:42 <vmassol> cjd: creating jira issue for maven  
09:43 <@cjd> anyone have any concerns with me starting now? I'd like to get this done quickly and I have a feeling sdumitriu will be in bed for the next few (or many) hours.  
09:44 <vmassol> cjd: reported as http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MENFORCER-133  
09:45 <vmassol> adding it to our pom.xml  
09:46 <@cjd> thanks, maven is such a magic black box for me, I can't even really tell if things like that are bugs or features :/  
09:47 <vmassol> it's supposed to be a black box ;)  
09:47 <vmassol> the only issue with black box is when they fail...  
09:47 <vmassol> \*boxes  
09:48 <@cjd> also they are not intuitive to use (for me) because you can't see how the inputs connect to the outputs  
09:49 <vmassol> sure it's an act of faith  
09:49 <vmassol> you need to trust the documentation  
09:49 <@cjd> yeah, I'm just not wired for it.. I've never found a piece of documentation I couldn't throw out and go read the code.  
09:50 <vmassol> well you can do that with mavne if you so wishes  
09:50 <vmassol> it's open source and the source is ready to find  
09:50 <@cjd> yeap, I just dare not look at it  
09:50 <vmassol> I do that regularly  
09:50 <vmassol> on plugins  
09:50 <vmassol> it's easy  
09:50 <@cjd> I imagine hundreds of XWikiDocument like classes...  
09:51 <vmassol> heh  
09:51 <vmassol> it's much nicer  
09:51 <vmassol> the archietcture is quite nice  
09:51 <vmassol> missing a lot of javadoc though  
09:51 <@cjd> that's good to hear  
09:52 <@cjd> oh we must have a debate on the rich v. anemic domain models when you have time.  
09:52 <vmassol> yep in july  
09:52 <vmassol> :)  
09:52 <vmassol> seminar  
09:52 <@cjd> sounds good  
09:53 <@cjd> Well I'm going to start and hope that nobody is in bed and needs to commit late patches.  
09:53 <vmassol> sounds good  
09:54 <@cjd> tmortagne: there are a couple issues here without documentation:  
09:54 <@cjd> http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator!eecuteAdvanced.jspa?jqlQuery=Project+in+%28%22XWiki+Commons%22%2C+%22XWiki+Rendering%22%2C+%22XWiki+Platform%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise+Manager%22%29+and+fixVersion+in+%28%224.1-rc-1%22%29+and+resolution+in+%28%22Fixed%22%29+and+%28%28Documentation+is+EMPTY%29+or+%28%22Documentation+in+Release+Notes%22+is+EMPTY%29%29&runQuery=true&clear=true  
09:54 <+tmortagne> always forget to set it in the jira issue, looking  
09:54 <vmassol> yep a mail has been sent to all committers this morning  
09:55 <vmassol> thomas has 2 and AndreasJonsson has one  
09:55 <@cjd> Andreas looks to have fixed it. It's a security issue so likely undocumented.. That's another topic for discussion, how to document those.  
09:56 <vmassol> we do document those  
09:56 <vmassol> we've already had this discussion  
09:56 <vmassol> AFAIR we just mention "security fixes" in the RN without giving too many details  
09:57 <+tmortagne> fixed, I just forgot N/A  
09:57 <+tmortagne> usually don't forget when there is something to put in it  
09:58 <@cjd> I've probably mellowed a bit on it all but my feeling is "argitrary filesystem read access by registered users, bug fixed" is the right approach. To some users it's just a bug.  
09:58 <@cjd> and some users would be scared and confused with the FUD the security industry pumps out  
09:58 <vmassol> cjd: you're rigth though. We've had the discussion but I think it was on skype and I don't think we have published the result on xwiki.org  
09:59 <vmassol> looks ok  
09:59 <@cjd> I guess the sec industry turns everything into a life-or-death disaster  
10:03 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <@cjd> jvdrean: good morning, anything holding up -rc-1 on your end?  
10:05 <+jvdrean> cjd: Hi, no  
10:06 <@cjd> great  
10:10 <+tmortagne> AndreasJonsson: got an idea and commented on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7894  
10:13 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <+mflorea> vmassol: I see you made some upgrades and closed the issue with N/A for release notes, but we have a Upgrades section in the release notes. Would be good to all those upgrades there, WDYT :) ?  
10:18 <vmassol> I thought about it  
10:18 <vmassol> but we don't need to advertise build stuff  
10:18 <+mflorea> ah, I see  
10:18 <vmassol> we don't even need jira issue for them  
10:18 <vmassol> I created them so that we have the release notes for the plugins  
10:19 <+mflorea> ok  
10:19 <CIA-114> Caleb James DeLisle stable-4.1.x \* rcf79ff7 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/cf79ff785d15a8f71cf5ffd045729ca0d02a884b / (3 files in 3 dirs): [release] Update translations. - http://git.io/mTJvlw  
10:19 <vmassol> for runtime upgrades we do need them in the RN  
10:19 <CIA-114> Caleb James DeLisle master \* r25dc11b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/25dc11b23e6fa3f279ffffeb7cfbefd1ba152106 / (3 files in 3 dirs): Merge branch 'stable-4.1.x' (+6 more commits...) - http://git.io/uljp5g  
10:22 <CIA-114> Caleb James DeLisle master \* ree1f445 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/ee1f445212101c3178eecf1d2d881fb0db2b20c1 / (2 files in 2 dirs): [release] Update translations - http://git.io/TK4ONw  
10:22 <CIA-114> Caleb James DeLisle master \* rc84be48 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/c84be4895fd2d1f70319acd4c120e5f3f06a0f82 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Merge branch 'stable-4.1.x' - http://git.io/DgEV8w  
10:24 <CIA-114> Caleb James DeLisle stable-4.1.x \* r25e3ae3 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/25e3ae3e7dcd681896a078993faca49ad9a0ec5f / (2 files in 2 dirs): [release] Update translations - http://git.io/MsmmxA  
10:25 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
10:25 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <+sburjan> cjd: should I test the latest snapshot, right ?  
10:41 <@cjd> sure, until rc-1 is built in staging  
10:42 <@cjd> there's a weird test failure which I need to assess  
10:42 <+sburjan> and this will happen today, right ? since we want rc-1 out today  
10:42 <@cjd> AndreasJonsson: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium-4.1/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/12/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/AdministrationTest/testConfigurationNotEditableWithoutPermission/  
10:42 <@cjd> yes, it will be really soon  
10:42 <Inge-> Release day chaos :)  
10:42 <@cjd> AndreasJonsson: any idea what might be causing this?  
10:43 <@cjd> it \*looks\* like it's from your patch to permissions and it's just harmlessly causing the test setup to no longer make sense but I want a second opinion.  
10:50 <@cjd> I'm going to go ahead since this is a minor test, it's failing in the setup, not what it's designed to check, any change to the permissions system is likely to trigger this test to fail.  
11:01 <AndreasJonsson> cjd: I'm loking at it...  
11:07 <@cjd> he can't edit the admin object because his permission isn't a global permission  
11:07 <@cjd> so the test is bunk  
11:07 <@cjd> that's what I'm getting from watching the test  
11:07 <@cjd> in which case we can remove the test since it's checking for something that will never happen  
11:17 <AndreasJonsson> cjd: Indeed, admin rights should have been assigned with a global rights object.  What really worries me is the fact that the test seems to have worked before ...  
11:19 <@cjd> it seems natural that it would have worked before since the user had the permission  
11:19 <AndreasJonsson> cjd: Ok, the test worked because someJoker didn't really have admin rights only "document admin" on XWiki.XWikiPreference (which could have been exploited to elevate privileges to admin, but noone would have actually configured "document admin" on XWiki.XWikiPreferences)

11:20 <@cjd> it was just setup that way, what it was checking was that you can't create a document and put a ConfigurableClass object in it and use that to cease control.
